content.description: Figure 1 shows some relevant details of a model of how a deoxynucleotide, in this case <math alttext="d T M P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>dTMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, is added to a growing strand of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Figure 1. Model showing details of adding a deoxythymidine monophosphate (<math alttext="d T M P" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>dTMP</mtext></mrow></math>) nucleotide to a growing strand of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> The features of this model provide evidence for which explanation of why all growing strands are synthesized in a <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> direction?

choices.label: The two strands need to be antiparallel to bond properly.

Thymine and adenine would not bond properly if the strand grew from <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The translation of <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs in the <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> direction; therefore, the growing <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strand must also grow in the <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> direction.

The phosphate group, attached to the <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> carbon of the <math alttext="d T M P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>dTMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, forms a covalent bond with the oxygen atom attached to the <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> carbon of the growing strand.
